text: Puss In Boots is a 2011 animated movie. It is a spin-off of the Shrek franchise. It follows the character Puss in Boots, who first appeared in Shrek 2. It is about his adventures before the events of Shrek 2. The movie was directed by Chris Miller, produced by Guillermo del Toro, and written by Brian Lynch. It stars Antonio Banderas as Puss in Boots, Zach Galifianakis as Humpty Dumpty, Salma Hayek as Kitty Softpaws, and Billy Bob Thornton and Amy Sedaris as Jack and Jill. Like the Shrek movies, this movie is a parody of fairy tales. == Home media release == Puss in Boots was released on DVD, Blu-ray and Blu-ray 3D on February 24, 2012. The movie has a short animation called Puss in Boots: The Three Diablos. 7.2 million home entertainment units have been sold worldwide. Another featured extra short is "Klepto Kitty"; a three-minute profile of Dusty the Klepto Kitty, a notorious cat in California who steals items from neighbors' yards. Some of it was filmed on a night vision kitty- cam, hung around Dusty's neck by the Animal Planet network for their own documentary. ==Sequel== A sequel titled Puss in Boots: The Last Wish was released on December 21, 2022. == References == ==Other websites== *Official website *Puss in Boots at the Internet Movie Database Category:2011 movies Category:DreamWorks Animation movies Category:Movie spin-offs Category:Prequel movies Category:Shrek Category:2010s English-language movies Category:Movies about cats Category:American 3D animated movies Category:Movies about motherâ€“son relationships
title: Puss in Boots (2011 movie)
